en: New modes result in __switchConfig__ configuration, __heldButton__ held button support and __longRelease__ long press support
The Standard Shutter and Toggle actions are only supported in a 4-button configuration!
Endpoint 23 and 24 need to be either both active or both inactive!
Unexpected endpoint for this button configuration
Manually turned on and off with the button only
Automatically turned on and off by the sensor
Automatically turned on by the sensor, manually turned off
Manually turned on, automatically turned off by the sensor
How many seconds the sensor needs to not see movement before being able to change from occupied to unoccupied again. If any movement is detected in this period, the timeout is restarted.
How many seconds the sensor needs to not see movement before being able to change from unoccupied to occupied again. If any movement is detected in this period, the timeout is restarted.
Light level above which motion does not activate the occupancy action, for example to not turn on lights during the day. The value represent 10000 * log10 of the illuminance threshold in Lux.
Action to take when motion is detected
Turn on when motion is detected, and off when no motion is detected.
Change the brightness to the unoccupied level when no motion is detected. If the unoccupied level is set to 0 switch between off and the last set dimming level.
Dimming percentage used by the brightness occupancy action when no motion is detected.
Manually turned on and off with the button only
Automatically turned on and off by the sensor
Automatically turned on by the sensor, manually turned off
Manually turned on, automatically turned off by the sensor
How many seconds the sensor needs to not see movement before being able to change from occupied to unoccupied again. If any movement is detected in this period, the timeout is restarted.
How many seconds the sensor needs to not see movement before being able to change from unoccupied to occupied again. If any movement is detected in this period, the timeout is restarted.
Light level above which motion does not activate the occupancy action, for example to not turn on lights during the day. The value represent 10000 * log10 of the illuminance threshold in Lux.
Action to take when motion is detected
Turn on when motion is detected, and off when no motion is detected.
CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use 4 Dimmer actions, and to avoid using the (inverted) Light and Scene actions.
CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use 4 Dimmer actions, and to avoid using the (inverted) Light and Scene actions.

CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use a Schneider Shutter action to reroute all actions via Homey, and a Dimmer action for full control otherwise.
CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use a Dimmer to reroute all actions via Homey, and a Schneider Shutter action for full control otherwise.
Maintenance mode prevents the motor from being operated through commands and buttons
The illuminance threshold used by the sun protection sensor, if connected. The value represent 10000 * log10 of the illuminance threshold in Lux.
The driving time in tenths of seconds from fully closed to open
The driving time in tenths of seconds from fully open to closed
Whether the connected window covering has tilt functionality
The driving time in hundreds of seconds from fully opened to closed tilt position

CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use a Schneider Shutter action to reroute all actions via Homey, or a Dimmer action to still have a short press turn the output on/off
Maintenance mode prevents the motor from being operated through commands and buttons
The illuminance threshold used by the sun protection sensor, if connected. The value represent 10000 * log10 of the illuminance threshold in Lux.
The driving time in tenths of seconds from fully closed to open
The driving time in tenths of seconds from fully open to closed
Whether the connected window covering has tilt functionality
The driving time in hundreds of seconds from fully opened to closed tilt position
How many minutes the device will stay hushed in hush mode
Whether the device attempts to maintain a temperature setpoint or follows a duty cycle.
The period of the regulator cycle in minutes. Choose a long time for (slow) concrete floors and a short time for (quick) hardwood floors.
Power load in Watt while heating.
Which sensor is used in thermostat mode.
The maximum temperature the floor is allowed to reach in the safe sensor mode.
The offset that should be applied to the measured temperatures in tenths of a degree Celsius.
After how many seconds the switch turns of. Pressing the on button before this happens resets the timeout.
Whether turning the switch off should also reset the automatic off timeout, instead of switching off
After switching on immediately switch off after 200ms, ignoring the automatic off timeout settings

CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use Schneider Shutter actions to reroute all actions via Homey, and Dimmer actions for full control otherwise.

CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use Schneider Shutter actions to reroute all actions via Homey, or Dimmer actions to still have a short press turn the outputs on/off

CAUTION: Not all configurations work with the full Homey functionality. It is recommended to use 4 Dimmer actions, and to avoid using the (inverted) Light and Scene actions. Please wake up the device by pressing its buttons after changing these settings.
